review_title: Not recommended if you have back problem
one_reviews_text: I enjoyed this game very much. I was very immersed in it. The physics felt right. It was an interesting story. HOWEVER, I have lower back problems and after playing this game for several hours I could hardly stand the next day. So, no back problems, I would recommend a definite buy. Back problems, skip it.

To date, one of the best looking games so far !
Very polished in many aspect, graphics (with gorgeous light effects), sound effects, musics, all is great !
The gameplay itself is fantastic ! The way you move with the kayak is extremely well done, pretty realistic. The stealth ops side is well transcribed, and gunplay is precise and satisfaying !
The campaign is good enough with some cool stuffs to unlock !
The cross-buy and "cross-profile-backup" is very appreciated !

Bravo to the devs !!

review_title: Stealth Kayak in VR, count me in!
one_reviews_text: I mean... Kayak!!!! In VR! With guns! Seriously the game has a few shortcomings but they really are minor given the amazing quality of the game. This is one of those rare VR games that really feels complete. And the kayak is really fun to navigate.

It is almost a "shoot the duck" game. The kayak physics is not great. Graphics are good, but nothing "Wow". The game plot is basic, trending to "this makes no sense".   

This is not a free-world game. The story is lineal, and the path you follow is also lineal. The NPC's intelligence is really low.  

The stealthiness is bad. As long as you are "hidden" according to your rada, you are hidden (even thouh most part of the kayak is exposed.


Don't buy this. Don't throw your money.  I whish I had a refund.
review_feedback: Thank you for providing feedback about your experience. It's disappointing to read that you found the stealth, movement mechanics, and tone within the game lacking, as these are often noted amongst the title's core strengths amongst players and critics. We hope you find a game more suited to you soon.

review_title: The name says it all - great game!
one_reviews_text:
TL;DR – Buy the game if you like lurking in the shadows.  Great story – great immersion – great acting – great music.  And, there is enough post-story fun to keep you coming back to it. SMASH the buy button – you'll have fun.

I grew up kayaking in the reeds on my lake with my friends and playing covert ops spying on snapping turtles, ducks, people washing boats, and yes the occasional pretty swimmer. I'll say the game is pretty real from the kayaking POV – it's true that you can sneak up on people way closer than you think.  It's amazing what you can do when you're quite and they're distracted. 

The immersion is really amazing in this game as you forget your sitting on your chair.   Your body actually believes you are on the water -- you can almost feel the reeds brushing your body.

This game impressed me with it's attention to detail.  The way you can speed into the reeds and they slow you to a stop, the sound of the paddle, speed paddling vs. creeping, the character reactions, even the occasional mosquito that buzzes by your ear.

You are supposed to be stealth, but you can do whatever you want in the game.  If you get too crazy with shooting, you'll end up dying because you are literally a  sitting duck. And, there is a point in the game where characters start wearing armor – no more head-shot kills.

The story was surprisingly interesting as they kept twisting it so that you weren't really sure who you were working for anymore – or who were the bad guys.  After the story, there is free play and challenges so the designers really thought about this as a long term skill game.

Quick observation: There is no kayaker that would put paddle on the side holder while in-boat. Always rest with the paddle across your lap. In a kayak, the primary thing you're constantly wrestling with is balance.  If you flip, you need that paddle in your hands to right yourself or drown.  Not a breaker - it's just not real.

Overall, though, the game is amazing!! Thanks for making!
Amazing game. My only complaint Is my shoulders started to hurt after paddling in a kayak for so long so I wish there was at least some parts where you aren’t in a kayak
I just got the game its done and it wont even load.
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback, this is definitely strange (and not something we've had reported recently). Please get in touch with support@ndreams.com and we can look into this for you.

one_reviews_text: This is why I bought a VR. Great game.

Played the campaign all the way through and enjoyed the stealth mechanics and the moody dark locations.  The rowing aspect, which at first appears contrived, actually works very well and is quite unique - I played the game sitting on the floor!

A wonderful game - recommended without hesitation.
Great game. But how do I disable the dynamic resolution?

review_title: good game but can't play the pc version
one_reviews_text:
I watched some videos of people playing the pc version so I decided to buy it but had to play the quest version because the game would never start but on the quest version it works fine.
Even though the game didn't look good on the quest, the performance is good, the story is pretty solid but I haven't finished it yet.
It's important to know that your arms do get tired after paddling for a while.
So in my opinion, it's worth buying the game
review_feedback: Thank you for this feedback and we're sorry to hear you had an issue with the PCVR version. Please can you email support@ndreams.com so we can look into and resolve this for you?

one_reviews_text: best best best

review_title: Not as good as I remembered
one_reviews_text:
After playing through the game the first time several months ago, and not worrying about dying and completing challenges etc...I decided to play it again and really try to make it through each level with stealth and complete challenges. 

Well...After playing the third level about 19 times...I realized that it was completely inconsistant. Sometimes the spotlight would shine right on me and I would not be noticed....and sometimes it would be 30 feet away, and they would see me...?!

Can still be fun, just have to get lucky and not have the spotlight see you from far away.

Very fun. Great kayak mechanics and not too many guns but it’s fine. Really loved the sniper. After finishing the game, I had a ton of fun just going back and throwing C4 on the boats and shooting at everyone. 

Pros
Good graphics
Pretty long story (took me like 3 hours to finish) 
Good story (and there are secret audio logs)
Good level replayability

Cons
 (IMPORTANT PLEASE FIX) When I tried to grab the C4, I would grab the detonator instead and the other way around. Maybe put the detonator on the right side of your lap?
Boss battle would’ve been nice...
Chill swamp stealth FPS.

I'm currently about 5 or 6 missions in and enjoying it quite a bit.
The whole thing feels very Splinter Cell-esque and is well done.
I've always enjoyed the stealth games like Splinter Cell, the Thief series, etc.

The graphics are very good, the sound and environment is immersive. The kayak controls are very good (but not perfect). I would give it 4.5 stars if I could for the weird rifle scope use, but that could just be VR two-handed weapon use in general.

A definite buy if you like steatlh games.

review_title: thank you for the quick response I
one_reviews_text: understand the reasoning.
review_feedback: Thank you for getting in touch and providing feedback, we do read every review so you didn't have to put a single star to grab our attention (as that does bring down our game's ranking and searchability). Haptics isn't something we're looking to implement at the moment but we're always open to player feedback, especially when it involves them sharing what they'd like to see in the future!

one_reviews_text: first played this and couldnt get into it, just gave it another go and it is a very good game, in fact I been hooked, you have to be in the mood for a bit of stealth, once you get used to the kayak the game becomes raelly good, in fact the kayaking is spot on, graphics let the game down but on 1.5 or above resolution in the oculus debug tool things look a lot better with a few changes to AA in game, good story and the sound is so well done, sniper scope is also well done, silenced pistol works well close up but dont expect to shoot from a distance, this is a nice touch and adds to realism, if you dont learn to use the kayak you just get annoyed but if you give it a try it works just like being in real life. Great stealth game which makes the times you use the waepons more fun. Played on Rift S.

Great game. For me, simply one of the best VR experiences and best immersions. My only complaint is really that it could be a bit longer. Everything else (paddling mechanics, gunplay, atmosphere, character models, difficulty settings etc.) works and feels great.

So, I was following this game before it came out, and purchased on release. I some of the first mission, found it kind of boring and put it aside. 

Over the last couple years, I've built up quite a few VR games in my library and I noticed many of them I had barely played, or never played at all. I realized that I had trouble getting over the "VR fog". I would put the headset on for maybe an hour max, and the first thing that tires me out or goes wrong I pretty much turn it off and do something else.

I decided to stop doing this and try and actually get into these longer experiences. Each day I've put a few hours into VR, Asgard's Wrath, Saints and Sinners, and today I was feeling extra lazy and decided to play some Phantom again. 

****Here's the review***

Phantoms graphics are not good at all. They are some of the worst graphics I've seen in VR even at 1.5 SS and Ultra everything. This was my initial turn off to the game. Toward the end of the first mission, things start to get a little more interesting. After completeing the 2nd mission, I was hooked. 

Once you get the actual kayak movement down, it feels great. Weapons feel good, and I use them quite a bit even though your score goes down because it's just more fun. There's almost always a couple different ways to go which is nice, and I was impressed by the "bosses" in the game. 

I've given this 4 stars for a couple reasons. The graphics are bad, I mentioned that, and that takes away a lot in VR, which already has poor graphics. The game is somewhat short and generic. I took a point for these two reasons. That being said, this game is good and you should play it. There aren't many 5 hour + experiences that keep it fresh in VR, so this one is worth it. 

- Played on CV1
- i7 9700KF
- 2070 Super
- 32 GB RAM

I've been looking at this for a few weeks now and due to the mixed reviews was on the fence about buying it. Youtube videos look good but I still couldn't decide. 

I don't know why I bother going by reviews to be honest, one man's meat is another man's poison and just because others don't like it doesn't mean I wont. For £23 , it's worth a punt and it helps the developers improve their titles and to keep on giving us pretty decent games such as this.

I'm playing this with my Oculus Quest 2 wirelessly, my graphics card is a Nvidia RTX 2060 , got the video settings maxed out in the game and it is only slightly blurry in places but overall graphically not bad at all. Good sound and atmosphere, the boat paddle control is a cynch and very intuitive and the gun firing, aiming and reloading are all very good and pretty precise. As others have said it would be nice to be a bit more involved where the reload of the weapon is concerned to give you that bit more of a immersive experience but this in my opinion is nit-picking.

I'm really enjoying this and I think there will be some replay value as you can go in and play in stealth mode or all guns blazing and then give it another go in a different way. I played about 45 mins right off the bat and got no arm ache at all. I'm certainly no athlete either .

Very good game, well worth your dosh, give it a go. You might like it !
fun
It was good, when it worked, but it keeps running into a "fatal error" and I can't get it working, again.
review_feedback: Thank you for taking the time to fill out a review. We're disappointed to hear you've been running into an issue. Please be sure to get in touch with us at support@ndreams.com if the problem persists and we can look into this for you.

review_title: this game was very well designed
one_reviews_text: in a boat going the the levels sniping guys and planting bombs awhile operating a boat with paddles a good workout and an excellent game the reality was amazing it was totally fun i cant wait for more this was a AAA game. ended too soon i wanted more. great game

review_title: Novel Idea but not a very fun one
one_reviews_text:
I think this kind of gameplay loop would be fun for like one mission where you control a kayak.  It controls how you'd expect a kayak to control but it being a kayak, it's hard to control and not very fun.  Moving your arms gets tiresome and you'll end up spamming quick small circle motions, similar to how you'd waggle a wiimote instead of using full swings.  It's almost like the devs realized that the main control was tiring so put this 'hack' into it?

Now moving a cumbersome kayak around is one thing but when you are trying to be stealthy can lead to frustration.  That and the gameplay loop itself isn't very fun.  I don't really like waiting around in reeds for enemies to move away.  Shooting guys isn't recommended and doesnt feel super great anyway.  The visuals aren't very good either.  Muddy wall textures everywhere even with high settings.  The environment itself doesn't look very good either.

This could be a fun segment in a call of duty style game but as an entire game it's just well, not very fun to control and the gameplay loop isn't deep enough.  I'd say try it for 10 bucks on sale to see if it's your cup of tea.

I like much yes yes

Best stealth game

review_title: one of the best games i've played
one_reviews_text: didn't think id like this but i was wrong, well thought out and great graphic's love playing this :)

review_title: Great game but needs some loving
one_reviews_text:
Enjoying the game but would like to suggest the following to improve:
1. The novelty of rowing gets tiresome really quick. Upgrade to a silent electric motor after the first mission
2. The scope on the sniper rifle is difficult and cumbersome to use. I suggest that you incorporate a hud scope similar to that used for the binoculars
3. The game is a little too linar and easy imo... more open options and tactics would be great

This game is a must for anyone who loves the stealth genre. As a lover of the splinter cell saga I immediately felt at home and it almost seems that Sam Fisher has given himself up to kayaking.

For the plot it seems instead to replay some of the best parts of Metal Gear Solid. Phantom Covert Ops is practically a perfect mix of the best that the major stealth games have been able to give us so far but in VR.

I can firmly say that if Splinter Cell and Metal Gear are the excellence of stealth games on PC and PlayStation respectively, Phantom Covert Ops is the perfect exponent of stealth in VR.

Its a good game for the price. Production value is very good. Whats there gets repetitive by the end, but hopefully the can expand on this concept in future games.  I would have like to have seen a little more progression or different enviornments.  And yes it would have been good to have some levels outside of the kayak just to break it up a bit.  The levels and gameplay did not change much throughought my playthrough.  Still glad I got it though and would recommend to others.  We need to support developers like this!

The mechanics, graphics, sound and ambience in this game are amazing.
This title is totally immersive and well done.
I thought I enjoyed Splinter Cell but Phantom: Covert Ops makes Sam Fisher look like he is in Call Of Duty....
I have three videos to share:

Short Trailer: https://youtu.be/qZOxZ8qBUvU

Full first mission: https://youtu.be/FdIAyXrMxjE

And Full second mission: https://youtu.be/HohXhESKBAQ

Check out VR Verdict Podcast on Twitter!

review_title: Good game, tiring for your arms
one_reviews_text: That's correct. I'm in my late 40's and I found my arms were getting tired from "rowing". I do not really enjoy the rowing mechanic. Yes, it's very realistic however there's a reason I don't row in real life. Also, aiming the sniper rifle is just odd- I could not for the life of me figure how to do it naturally. Overall it seems like a very polished title, however it's not a good fit for me.

This game is a shinning example of what vr can be. The feeling of paddling the phantom is very realist, and actually  relaxing at times. This game has an extremely well balanced feel challenging, but no so hard as to be off putting. Just the care the devs put into this games shows at every level. Keep up the good work guys!

1st Impressions Video with Commentary // Oculus Rift S // GTX 1060 (6GB):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HncIUrB4ymk

*QUEST V'S Rift S COMPARISON VIDEO:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_TSfdhWUfmo

My Initial Thoughts:
Everything about this game so far feels so natural.... the kayaking mechanics are superb and really spot on, the game oozes quality in its concept, uniqueness and execution.
The developers have a great history of making quality VR games and it shows with this title.
If you like Stealth games, you're going to love this, so cherish every moment!

review_title: Thank God I brought my kayak
one_reviews_text:
Everything in the game works great.  Graphics are excellent and the nighttime setting hides a lot of the little graphical issues of close up VR views.   The movement feels spot on for rowing and turning.  The layout of your inventory in the kayak feels good.  Everything is in a good position to grab when you need it.  This is medium to high on the motion sickness chart due to the twisting and turning of the kayak.  I am medium  for tolerance and could feel a few times where my brain was warning me, but nothing so strong that I had to stop.  Do almost an hour at a time and feel pretty good afterwards.
Now, the stealth gameplay really fits this style of movement in a strange, but great way.  You can slowly creep around, paddling slowly, then pick it up when you want to "sprint" to cover.  The levels are laid out nicely to have you wandering what's around the next bend.  Gotta say, arms are kinda tired.
Excellent game, played on Rift S.

I was not sure what to expect from a stealth action seated expierence game. I figured you would kyak to a loaction and disembark for some action. That being said, I can state this style of game play was not only refreshingly new, it was well planned and paced. I loved this expierence. the levels were put together well and the animations were spot on. Once I completed the game, I went back and played the missions again because it was that fun. I see there is some new content with the update. So its time to load up my kiyak and continue the mission.

For whatever reason, I believed the kayak rowing was an intro to the actual stealth game, and so I purchased this nonsense. I was infuriatingly trying to reach shore, like Solid Snake, and get to the actual game... but that was not to be. I was to stear a kayak as though it were a bus. Half-Life:Alyx is $15 more than this. This effort is shameful.
review_feedback: We're very disappointed to hear our game was not to your liking or what you expected, we aim to make our marketing as clear as possible as to what the game involves, with the kayak being core to the gameplay loop. We appreciate your feedback nonetheless.

one_reviews_text:
Obviously all the polish is here, its cinematic, and gritty and whatnot, but come on. Why the hell am i in a canoe? Its not fun at all. Youre just swinging your arms in air for no good reason constantly. 

It makes no sense in the context, im hiding from enemies with machine guns in a boat? and i have a machine gun myself but my movement is handicapped enough that its not even worth using. its just surreal how this idea could have been designed by professionals. 

Its about as fun as Onward if Onward had Wheelchair locomotion. One of the weirdest dumbest exeriments ive seen in VR to date.

TLDR; An amazingly good game, wrecked by (an easily fixable) motion sickness.
DEVEPLOPERS pleases contact me for more information.  This is easily fixed.   I've got over 1000hrs in Pavlov, Onward, etc.  Don't get sick easily, but this game made me very sick.  DON'T ROTATE the CAMERA, this is known to cause motion sickness.  Easily fixed by developer if they gave us an option when paddling/turning rotated the cannon, but not the camera.  I can handle the snap turning, but normal paddling to turn even a little bit is sickening due to the camera (view) rotating.   If normal paddling just rotated the cannon, but not the camera, the player would naturally turn around in there seat to rotate, motion sickness solved.  Check Wardust & Standout, in these games I can drive at high speed with no sickness because they use this method.  BTW, your 'comfort' blinkers do NOT work.  I've tried every setting. (I own a kayak in real life.)
For such an polished game, I just can't work out how the game got thru like this.
review_feedback: Thanks for the detailed feedback! While we already have comfort solutions built into Phantom, we are aware that they might not suit every player. We're always looking for new ways to improve our games, I've passed your feedback on to the development team.

review_title: Great idea / graphics, bad gun play!
one_reviews_text:
Visually the game is great! Excellent lighting and graphics textures. The gun play is very much below average. After playing games like pavlov, onward, contractors, gun club and many other VR shooters, the gun play feels very rough and extremely artificial. 
As others have said the rowing kind of gets old really really fast. The trick is to keep your arms in close to your body and do short rolling motions with your wrists.

First a tip: a lot of people talk about their arms getting tired. Just like real kayaking make sure you can rotate your back (so no backrest). Your torso will rotate releasing tension from your arms and shoulders.

Regarding the game: I like it however as a kayakker I am missing some handling that easily could have been implemented into the game. Rolling to hide from a searchlight, moving sideways by either sculling or pulling one paddle and more important steering by carving. Paddling with one arm (just minor movement to get a better view or shot). I do not know if they consulted a kayakker but doesn't seem they did. That's a pity.

review_title: Without a doubt a true AAA Title!
one_reviews_text: Many thanks to the Devs. Graphics are great and the gameplay and controlls are on the spot. It's a perfect mix of Metal Gear Solid and Splinter Cell. Sneak past your enemies or take them all out-it's your choice. Ilove this game!!! The first real AAA stealth action game in VR. It can easely catch up with Asgard's Wrath, Half Life-Alyx, Stormland and all the other big budget games. Go for it and have fun! And excuse my english...I'm german;-)

What's not to love, a stealth game set during the Cold War. A little kayaking. It is a crazy concept, but the game takes it so seriously that after a short time, I was totally into playing from a kayak! And I love that it is a seated experience. Plop down on the couch. The game offers stealth and direct action modes...I prefer the stealth. Though, sometimes it is fun to just start blazing and see what happens and then replay the part for a better ranking. I hope this is the first game of many from this "franchise"...if it becomes one. Phantom was (is) a lot of fun to play.

This game plays amazingly! The paddle control is smooth and works better than other games that use the same control style. The AI is solid enough. You can play casual or have a tough challenge. The atmosphere is great and had me swatting around my head when a bug would supposedly fly up to my ear thanks to great sound design. There are extra challemges and things to do for replayability. The only thing I had an slight issues with was the goggles, guns, etc were a bit floaty and didnt appear to have any weight so your arms would kind of float around a bit when pulling out a weapon to aim or looking through goggles and returning them to your storage. Other than that tiny bit of slightly odd feeling animation, the rest of the game plays and looks as close to AAA as you can get. Everyome should own this game!

review_title: I was wrong its good. slow mo seems bugy
one_reviews_text:
i was skeptical about the whole kyak idea, but they pulled it off great. it feels like a full legit game, with great hand interactions and stuff. i do wish i could zoom, with the binoculars and the rifle scope. the rifle barely zooms at all.
also i wish that i could pull my magazine out to check it, or at least pull the old one out to put in a new one. right now the ammo counter is on the guns, and.you slap a mag in from your satchel, like blood and truths car segments, but its limited. 
also you dont really get to rack the weapons....

all in all its great. level design is top notch. even in a kyak, the areas feel open and like there are some thought going into the tunnels and overall architecture. its great and i would like to see more like this.

Con's, i would say theres some issues but not many. there is a issue with dropping items. most items lock to your hand, which im not a fan of in general, but i get it. but when putting new ammo or gear in your pouches, it lags and looks janky. half the time im not sure if it went in or if it fell through the kyak, becuase there also is no physical prescense, other than with interactables or such.  
also theres not enough chances to use the cool gadgets so far, maybe chapter 5 is still early, but i thought it was close to the end.  theres not a whole lot to bad talk here though, the games pretty straightforward with what it does. it feels great when you kyak like a boss.

biggest issue i have is the slow mo never triggers correctly, making some what would be very cool metal gear solid moments void, and sometimes lead to a early death. maybe this is the stealth systems fualt, but i also wish you had a adreneline meter and could use slow mo at any time. thats the main reason i deduct a star.

The game and its mechanics are very solid.
It takes a few minutes to be comfortable with the control of the canoe but it quickly becomes very intuitive, and for what it lasts, the game is very good from beginning to end.

But when I say "for what it lasts" is the reason I gave it only 3 stars.
It ends way too soon and at the end, I felt like it was going to continue on another chapter...after all, I just did 1 mission in 1 environment so it would be normal that the game continue on a brief to another mission, right?

Except, no. It just ends there...feels like playing the first chapter of a game and then, credits roll, and you ask yourself where are the other 2 chapters?

If the game was longer and also not as easy (it's extremely easy...which is also why I really though there was more to it) it would've been an easy 5.
But as is, it just feels like the game isn't complete...more like a lengthy demo of a game. I even have to come back here to see if I didn't miss the mention "early access".

Hopefully some more content will eventually come to fill the void.

review_title: Highly Quality Stealth Title with issues
one_reviews_text:
Covert Ops is a high quality title and one of the best stealth VR games currently available.   Here is my full first impressions video  https://youtu.be/ovSNJrLZN_U
I originally experienced some motion sickness but it was actually due to being physically ill

I would give it 3 stars based on the fact a lot of games in the VR store aren't even finished and shouldn't be available for sale. 

The game is the same concept over and over. You sit in a Kayak and paddle in circles (Seated Mode ONLY).  If you shoot someone you lose points. The graphics are poor.  Their is no originality in this game, you repeat the same thing over and over.

 It is very hard to use the sniper rifle.  After you  complete the first first minutes you have played the entire game as it simply repeats. Overall worth maybe $10.

i dont get motion sick so i cant tell you if it helps with that, but i do know its a good game visually and mechanicly. Edit: good for arm exercise too

ideas:
* manual reload option {including pulling back the bolt on your sniper}cv  for those who want increased realism
*make it so you can stand and lean back in your kayak for easier shots
*add a sniper elite style weapon system where you choose your sniper, smg, and pistol
*make it so you can drag enemies into water {i havent tried this yet so mabye its already in the game}

Such a fun ride begining to finish. You are full emersion into a whole new way to look at stealth! Feels so good like your playing your childhood imagination of being a stealth soldier! Its a must have if you ask me especially if you ever played a COD game or Splinter Cell or Metal Gear action! Thank you producers programers visuals everything.

Game was super duper from start to finish. it will take 6-8 hours ro complete, it dosen't outstays it's welcome and has a satesfying end, mechanics are solid, i do wish you would have a bit more to do when you relode other the just pop a mag in, but it dident bother me all that much, 5/5 from me

It's new, it's different, i've never seen or experienced anything like it in video games or VR before. It's pretty, got a cool story, and cool mechanics. I 100% recommend it to any VR player. I got a little motion sick during the first mission, but i quickly got used to it and it no longer bothers me.

Update: after my first ghost stealth playthrough, im going back in with better weapons using russian stealth. no one can see me if no one is alive

First the gripes. Bought on Friday, finished by Saturday, approx 4 hours to complete campaign then done. Some Rift textures could be better. One soldier detected me through a pillar and shot me (through the pillar) and I couldn't shoot them back, not good enough on a full price game. Using the scope is poorly done and awkward, compared with say, Zero Caliber or Pavlov. Now the pros, VR stealth done right, and deserves to be mentioned in the same breath as MGS. Atmospheric too, the shining torches, reeds and splashing water is immersive. What there is of the short campaign is done well, and I cannot fault the story or voice acting. Controlling the kayak is easy to get into and feels intuative. Spending the entire game afloat also works. Explosions are immense making you want to blow stuff up rather than stay quiet. The Quest version is surprisingly good, with some areas rivalling Rift graphically. Cross buy is always welcome and generous on the part of the developer. All in all, not a AAA title but a solid 4 star title and an enjoyable stealth game done right, but with minor niggles which will hopefully be ironed out in due course.

This game was waiting on my wishlist it’s finally here and oh so worth the wait! Gameplay is REALLY immersive and the production value is obvious from the sound quality to the impressive graphics and textures and the list goes on. Great campaign/story which most VR games lack in my opinion. Conducting covert ops in a tactical kayak make you feel like a navy seal and it’s pretty epic I have to say! Good job nDreams 👌🏼

Not a game you want to play if you want to relax.
Amazing game though

I have really enjoyed playing this game as its a different experience from anything else I've played. Its really immersive and yeah it'll exercise your arm but thats  to be expected. It  doesn't ruin the experience at all as my quest was purchased to take advantage of the full range  movement of my body.  Great job on an excellent title I would recommend to anyone.

I first downloaded it on the quest and even though the graphics where ok, I opted to check out the pc version before continuing with the game. I noticed the quest version was 3gb+ while the pc version was 8gb+. 
The extra five gb made all the difference for me with the amazing detail added to the pc version where this game truly shines making me feel totally immersed, I felt like I was actually there.

 As it's a seated game I will continue playing on the pc with the oculus link as the detail is so much better.

To the developers:
Thank you for an amazing game as it is right now, however the game has great potential for a unique online co-op with a double seated kayak or a group of kayaks set against each other in a pvp or simply taking out terrorists/zombies or avoiding them or all of the above options put together lol!

Anyway, thanks for a wonderful game!
Five stars from me*****
Buy it!
Enjoyment to play but the crashes are beyond annoying, fix the crashing and will add to 5 stars.

I think the game is priced correctly at $30 its worth every cent of that...Ive had no issues with motion sickness and I do suffer from it in a few games...Ive had no issue getting to grips with the weapony including the sniper rifle its all pretty standard fare..Im quite enjoying playing a VR game seated for a change and havent had any arm fatigue from the paddling mechanic which I find pretty natural having kayaked a lot in real life...Its a good game.

Great new quality VR title for Oculus owners to enjoy. ...
Having just finished HLA I was worried nothing was around to give a comparable quality experiance. This came and saved the day thats for sure!
It makes a plesent change to find a seated game and the atmosphere and mechanics are very well thought out. I have seen some complain about the constant padling required but hey!! What kind of soldier are you??
Highly recomended - buy it you will not be disapointed.

The performance is great. I'm forcing CV1 ss 2.0 (oc'ed 1080), and although I get dips below 90 with High details, the game runs really close to 90 fps. 
Textures might not be Alyx quality, but you do not notice that using the CV1. Love that you got arms and a body - you don't get that in Alyx ;) Weapons look awesome. 
The game supports temporal antialiasing as the highest/best level of antialiasing - this usually means that the game was designed for Oculus oled hmds, because temporal antialiasing looks really blurry with lcd hmds, but there are other non-temporal options available.
When selecting High detail settings, you do not get the highest available settings, because dynamic shadows can be increased another notch. Doing that did have a significant performance impact on my rig - but it looked really great. You may need at least a 1080 Ti or better to max out the game using CV1 and ss 2.0.
Paddling felt real - I do understand if some may experience motion sickness, but there are some aids and lower difficulty levels for persons new to VR. 
My rating is 9/10 for now - it's one of the most beautiful and captivating games with the CV1 (devs also recommend headphones, smells like CV1 to me ;)

My trip in flooded Russian city was gorgeous. I love stealth games and this is good one but on Kayak? Yeah it work, if you could normaly walk it will be better but this is uniqe style to move. 
I'm doesn't afraid and I play it on first time on Veteran difficulty. AI - not bad but in many times didn't see nothing and sometimes see like superhumans...graphics look nice but on High settings it too mutch motion blur (blurry) for my. Very well done, more VR similar games like that one :)

This game really showed canoeing 2.0 with great cinematic effects. I really enjoyed this title.
For future developers who want to create a great canoeing game should try this game. 
I'm looking forward to seeing these kinds of games in the future.
Really well-done job

review_title: this was the best VR game i have playd
one_reviews_text:
this was the best VR game i have playd yet i mean its just amazing
the story was vary good! who would have thout that you could an whole game in a kyake!

I'm usually not a fan of seated VR games so, at first, I wasn't sure if I'd like the whole kayak "gimmick" thing, but I ended up loving it. Everything about this game was so well done. I completed it on PC and then, after noticing it was cross-play, I played throug the first few levels on Quest. The graphics are noticably better on PC, but still very impressive on Quest, considering the hardware differences. I would 100% recommend this on either platform. It also has cloud saves, so you can go back and forth between the Quest and PC, as needed. I could not be more impressed with this game. Easily a 5-star experience. I'm already looking forward to a sequel or DLCs. Honestly, a fishing game or basic exploration game, using this games kayaking mechanics, would be pretty cool, too.

Wasnt as good as i was expecting, and to be frank mostly quite dull and boring, the stealth is more a case of wait-go-wait, rather than engaging and the game was very easy even playing my first time on the hardest setting possible.

the Controls are mostly fine but the fast turn feature was confusing, feels like it needs inverting... 

Whilst there are 7x Campaign Levels, dont be fooled into thinking that they are vast areas or all different, in fact the arena is tiny and you repeat the same path/routes over and over...

In addition to the campaign mode, there are freeplay modes and extra challenges that make up for the lack of campaign but these addon extras are 57% of the entire experience.

I waited months for this, quite the anti climax. There are only so many different ways to do the same thing from a canoe/kayak. And graphically... well all I will say is take a look at half life on steam... shows what is actually achievable for a rift/quest link. 

Good concept though.
Water looks good and that's about it wish I had not wasted my money one half hour play and lost interest
review_feedback: Thank you for filling out a review, we always appreciate player feedback. Since launch, we've updated the already great core package with a number of free DLC updates that boost replayability with fun challenges and developer-approved cheats.

one_reviews_text:
The Kayak is alot of fun to cruise around in.  I was hoping for more accurate water simulation but this does strike a nice balance between realism and arcade.  Everything looks pretty good in the CV1 RIft especially the water reflections and lighting.  It is a bit rough around some edges like the patrol boats that have very stiff movement and don't move like boats in water should.  Also the volume of a big splash is not much louder then when you're going slow so its hard to tell how much noise you're making.  The sound for everything else is excellent.  When someone speaks, you know exactly where they are.

The campaign is of decent length.  The first run through could take anywhere from 6-10 hours, it took me about 8.  There's a freeplay mode to go back and use alternate paths as well as a challenge mode so there's a decent amount of content.  

It is very much enjoyable.  I think it would be near perfect if it had more realistic water or varied enviroments.  I would love to see the Devs stick with this and give it some more love or even make a side game thats just adventure kayaking down raging rivers.

Immersive and well done. Graphics could be better but game play makes up for it. Sitting down playing this game is really great! I had to switch to Revive and Index though. For some reason I got sick on Rift (CV1). Recommeded!

Took a while to get settings right on Rift CV1 with RTX 2060 super, used debug tool for Pixel density 1.4, forced asw enabled 45fps , used [/Script/Engine.Engine]
DisplayGamma=2.1 in Engine ini, in game settings aa temporal and everything else high. Takes a short time to get used to kayak and then feels very natural. Love the stealth aspects and as previously metioned ambience is amazing. Motion sickness not a problem so far. Favourite VR experience since Half life Alyx
Did not like the game and my refund was refused.
review_feedback:
Hi Darmin,
Sorry to hear that you had issues refunding the game. This should not be happening after less than 2 hours of playtime. Please contact Oculus Support at this link: https://support.oculus.com/885981024820727/ where you can get answers about your refund status.

one_reviews_text: I have been waiting so long for this game! Its everything intense you could ever want! Almost like youre actually in a stealth mission! THANK YOU!! I loved it an uploading a youtube video on it!

I'm really enjoying this game, it's meeting expectations. The goal is always stealth, combat is a last resort (you will lose points for doing so). Designing it as a sitting experience in a kayak was a great idea. I'll be spending a lot of time in this one.
Really nice, not perfect. Just very happy they build stuff like this for us to enjoy.
